idea-plugin.name: AsyncTest Caller
idea-plugin.description:
AsyncTest Caller

AsyncTest Caller is an IntelliJ IDEA plugin designed to scan Spring Web projects and automatically extract API endpoint information.

The plugin analyzes Spring MVC / Spring Boot controllers, collects structured interface metadata (such as paths, HTTP methods, and related models), and synchronizes this data to the AsyncTest platform in a well-organized, structured format.

By automating API discovery and synchronization, AsyncTest Caller helps keep your AsyncTest interface definitions consistent, up-to-date, and tightly aligned with your source code, reducing manual maintenance and integration errors.

Key Features

  • üîç Scan Spring Web / Spring Boot controller interfaces
  • üß© Build structured API and data model information
  • üîÑ Synchronize interface data with the AsyncTest platform
  • ‚ö° Improve consistency between backend code and test definitions

AsyncTest Caller is ideal for teams that want to bridge the gap between Spring-based backend services and AsyncTest, enabling efficient API management and automated test integration.

Compatibility & Supported Versions

AsyncTest Caller is engineered to ensure broad compatibility across the JetBrains ecosystem. It is compiled with Java 17 compatibility to support older IDE versions while remaining fully functional on the latest releases.

  • Minimum Requirement: IntelliJ IDEA 2021.2.1 (Build 212+)
  • Maximum Requirement: None (Supports 2022.x, 2023.x, 2024.x, and future releases)
  • Verified Versions: The plugin has been verified against:
    • IntelliJ IDEA 2022.3
    • IntelliJ IDEA 2023.1
    • IntelliJ IDEA 2024.1+

Whether you are maintaining legacy projects on an older IDE or using the cutting-edge EAP version, AsyncTest Caller has you covered.


Privacy Policy

Last Updated: December 23, 2025

By using the AsyncTest Caller plugin, you verify that you agree to the following terms regarding data collection and usage.

1. Data Collection & Transmission

  • Source Code Scanning: The plugin scans your project files locally to identify API definitions (e.g., Spring Controllers).
  • Data Upload: When you explicitly click "Upload" or "Sync", API metadata is transmitted to the AsyncTest server.
  • Destination: Data is sent only to the server URL you configured in Settings > Tools > AsyncTest Caller.

2. User Control

  • No background uploads occur without your explicit action or configuration.
  • You have full control over the server URL and Access Token.

3. Data Usage

The transmitted data is used solely to generate test cases and sync API definitions on the AsyncTest platform.

For more details, please contact us via our GitHub(https://github.com/SheldonParsons/AsyncTest-Caller) repository.
